messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Happy Thanksgiving
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 11/25/2009 8:14:57 P.M. Eastern Standard Time, Sandra@SandraDodd.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 11/25/2009 8:14:57 P.M. Eastern Standard Time,
Sandra@... writes:

<<<My other gratitude posts are here, and I'll make a new one now. SO
glad you reminded me!

_http://sandradodd.http://sahttp://sahttp://sandrahttp://sandrahttp://sandrh
ttp_
(http://sandradodd.blogspot.com/2009/11/gratitude-project-week-five-of-six.html) >>>


Ah! Possibly that was the original source on Facebook for the daily
giving-of-thanks status "challenge". I got it from someone else, but I'm really
pleased and thankful that it spread around-it is a great thing for
unschooling, from what I can tell. The one I picked up was "one status update of
something you're thankful for each day through Thanksgiving", but mine has
evolved.

It has prompted me to start thinking of things I am thankful for
throughout the day, unprompted. It has been so *nice*, thinking of nice things,
wonderful stuff, happy things that it has made all our lives a bit brighter and
happier. Mind you, I'm definitely an optimist and generally happy, but I
can still occasionally get "stuck" in "this sucks" kind of attitudes, but
this thankfulness exercise seems to have done the trick for being able to move
away from that kind of thinking, quickly. Maybe I've formed new synapses
or exercized and strengthened parts of the brain that needed it, but it has
definitely changed the way I think. I'm enjoying posting something thankful
every day *so* much that I'm going to continue indefinitely. Whenever it
stops being new or it becomes challenging to think of something new I'm
thankful for, it will dwindle out of existence for me. Right now, I'm having a
hard time sticking to ONE a day. :~)

I hope everyone has a wonderful time with their loved ones today-we all
have so very much to be thankful for.

Peace,
De


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Happy Thanksgiving
messages.msgSnippet: -=- I am very thankful this year for all my friends and family and for finally completing my chemo and being cancer free!=- Good, Pebs!! This reminds me that
messages.messageBody:
-=-
I am very thankful this year for all my friends and family and for
finally
completing my chemo and being cancer free!=-

Good, Pebs!! This reminds me that it's Wednesday and I didn't finish
my gratitude set. I still have time.

I'm grateful for this list and so many people who participate!

My other gratitude posts are here, and I'll make a new one now. SO
glad you reminded me!

http://sandradodd.blogspot.com/2009/11/gratitude-project-week-five-of-six.html

Sandra

messages.subject: Happy Thanksgiving
messages.msgSnippet: Happy Thanksgiving just wanted to wish everyone here a Happy Thanksgiving day tomorrow. Hope yous all have a wonderful day. I am very thankful this year for
messages.messageBody:
Happy Thanksgiving


just wanted to wish everyone here a Happy Thanksgiving day tomorrow. Hope yous
all have a wonderful day.

I am very thankful this year for all my friends and family and for finally
completing my chemo and being cancer free!

Pebs
